oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 5th Tenn. Regt. Chapter, United Daughters of the Confederacy, No. 535, signature quilt
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Signature quilt made by the 5th Tenn. Regt. Chapter, United Daughters of the Confederacy, No. 535, in Paris, Tenn. Names of community members as well as soldiers of the 5th Tenn. Inf. Regt. are embroidered on the quilt top. Cpl. R. B. Olive's name is; included on the quilt. Olive was born in Henry County, Tenn., on June, 18, 1843. He enlisted in Co. F, 5th Tenn. Inf. Regt. on May 20, 1861. He was paroled May 1, 1865, at Greensboro, North Carolina, as corporal of Co. D, Consolidated Tenn. Inf. Olive was; 1 of 30 of the original 5th Tenn. Inf. Regt. members who surrendered to W. T. Sherman. A letter included in his Confederate pension states that he �was in every battle in which his regiment was engaged." Olive died on May 24, 1922, in Winters, Texas.
